Package doerfer

Class AdvancedGameView

java.lang.Object
doerfer.AdvancedGameView
All Implemented Interfaces:
doerfer.preset.GameView
public class AdvancedGameView extends Object implements doerfer.preset.GameView
Class AdvancedGameView Main method for input and (graphical) output. Has its own Master-Board which is updated and shown.
Author:
Jannis Fischer

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    private class 
    AdvancedGameView.AdvancedKeyListener
    Class AdvancedKeyListener Used for keyboard input like navigation(wasd,up,down,left,right,+,-,0), to take Screenshots(F2) and to toggle 2D/3D vision
    private class 
    AdvancedGameView.AdvancedMouseWheelListener
    Class AdvancedMouseWheelListener Listens to the mouseWheel to rotate the visual tile at the top of the stack and with control+mouseWheel one can zoom in and out
    private class 
    AdvancedGameView.DummyMA
    Class DummyMA MouseListener which is added to each DummyTile to detect left-clicks then placing a tile

  • Field Details

    • o

      private final Observer o
      Observer object which coordinates all turns in the game and controls the GameView

    • board

      private static Board board
      Master-game-board. From this board, all objects are shown.

    • yScale

      private float yScale
      Scale in y-direction of all tiles on the board. Default: 1f. Use 0.625 vor "3D-view"

    • panel

      private static doerfer.preset.graphics.GPanel panel
      GPanel which is responsible for the graphics. Holds one GGroup each for the mainLayer and the HUDLayer

    • mainLayer

      private static doerfer.preset.graphics.GGroup mainLayer
      MainLayer, on which the board is shown. Is part of GPanel. Also, mouse listener are added to mainLayer of objects of it.

    • HUDLayer

      private static doerfer.preset.graphics.GGroup HUDLayer
      HUDLayer, on which the whole user-interface is shown, eg. card-stack, player-icons, ...

    • frame

      private static JFrame frame
      The frame, on which the mainLayer and the HUDLayer are shown

    • nextnewTiles

      private final List<AdvancedTile> nextnewTiles
      List for the upcoming tiles on the stack. Just for drawing purposes, as these AdvancedTiles are non-interactive objects.

    • newTile

      private AdvancedTile newTile
      Tile on the top of the stack. When left-clicking on a dummy tile, this tile is placed on the specific position.

    • tileRotation

      private int tileRotation
      The rotation of the AdvancedTile "newTile" on top of the stack is saved.

    • defaultZoom

      private final float defaultZoom
      Default zoom of the MainLayer (the board), when starting the game or pressing "0"
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • defaultX

      private final int defaultX
      Default x-position of the viewpoint on the mainLayer (board)
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • defaultY

      private final int defaultY
      Default y-position of the viewpoint on the mainLayer (board)
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • shiftX

      private int shiftX
      Current x-coordinate of the viewpoint on the mainLayer (board)

    • shiftY

      private int shiftY
      Current y-coordinate of the viewpoint on the mainLayer (board)

    • scale

      private float scale
      Current zoom-factor of the viewpoint on the mainLayer (board)

    • drawablePlayerList

      private final List<doerfer.preset.graphics.GElement> drawablePlayerList
      List of the PlayerIcons shown in the bottom left corner. Used to translate (highlight) the active player

    • activePlayer

      private doerfer.preset.Player activePlayer
      Player whose turn it currently is.

    • lastMoveFailed

      private boolean lastMoveFailed
      Remembers if the last move failed (e.g. the user tried to place the new/current Tile on a position, where it is possible, but the rotation is wrong). Then no new tile is used

    • dummysOnStack

      private final List<DummyTile> dummysOnStack
      List von the DummyTiles on the stack. Is used to remove those dummys, if there are fewer cards on the stack

    • gameOver

      private boolean gameOver
      If the game is over, this variable is true

    • text

      private final doerfer.preset.graphics.GText text
      GText object which indicated how many dummy (unrevealed) tiles are on the stack. Is shown, when the number is greater 3

    • overlayFirst

      private doerfer.preset.graphics.GElement overlayFirst
      Saves the 3D-Overlay of the new tile (the top tile on the stack) to remove it from the HUDLayer, when it is needed

    • overlayList

      private final List<doerfer.preset.graphics.GElement> overlayList
      List of all 3D-Overlays of the revealed tiles on the stack, but not the top one. Is used to remove them from the HUDLayer, when it is needed

    • playerSkipped

      private final boolean[] playerSkipped
      Saves, which of the players where skipped to show it on the board.

    • skipOverlayList

      private final List<doerfer.preset.graphics.GElement> skipOverlayList
      Saves the drawable objects, when a player is skipped. Is used to remove the objects from the HUDLayer, when its needed

    • points

      private final Integer[] points
      Saves the current points of all players.

    • drawablePointList

      private final List<doerfer.preset.graphics.GText> drawablePointList
      List of text elements which show the points of the players.

    • mainLayerOverlays

      private final List<doerfer.preset.graphics.GElement> mainLayerOverlays
      List of GElements to remove them from the mainLayer when its needed

    • threeD

      private boolean threeD
      True, if 3D vision of the board is used

    • path

      private final String path
      Safes the absolute Path

  • Constructor Details

    • AdvancedGameView

      public AdvancedGameView(Observer ob) throws IOException, com.kitfox.svg.SVGElementException
      Constructor. Sets most of the used class variables, creates the HUD-Objects like the player icons and the dummys on the stack and creates the JFrame which is shown
      Parameters:
      ob - Observer which controls the GameView
      Throws:
      IOException - Exception from addChild and GElement
      com.kitfox.svg.SVGElementException - Exception from GPanel

  • Method Details

    • createPlayerIcons

      public void createPlayerIcons() throws IOException
      Creates the PlayerIcons and adds them to the HUDLayer Also adds the text which shows the points of the specific player
      Throws:
      IOException - from GElement

    • setNewTileNull

      public void setNewTileNull()
      Sets the newTile to null. Is used to tell the GameView, that it is possible to get a newTile

    • setPlayers

      public void setPlayers(List<doerfer.preset.Player> pList, List<Color> cList)
      Sets the players and the colors of the specific player. Not used
      Specified by:
      setPlayers in interface doerfer.preset.GameView
      Parameters:
      pList - List of players
      cList - List of colors in the same order as the players

    • setActivePlayer

      public void setActivePlayer(doerfer.preset.Player player)
      Updates, which player is the active one. Also highlights the specific player-icon and de-highlights the previous.
      Specified by:
      setActivePlayer in interface doerfer.preset.GameView
      Parameters:
      player - Player which is active

    • setPlayerSkipped

      public void setPlayerSkipped(doerfer.preset.Player player, boolean b)
      If a player is skipped or not skipped anymore, this method should be called to save and show this
      Specified by:
      setPlayerSkipped in interface doerfer.preset.GameView
      Parameters:
      player - Player who is skipped or not
      b - true, if player is skipped, else false

    • placeTile

      public void placeTile(doerfer.preset.Tile tile, doerfer.preset.TilePlacement tilePlacement, doerfer.preset.Player player)
      Is called to place a Tile on the board. If this is not possible, the screen is lighting red for a short time, indicating tha move wasn't valid. If it was valid, the player is called to make their move.
      Specified by:
      placeTile in interface doerfer.preset.GameView
      Parameters:
      tile - The advancedTile that should be placed
      tilePlacement - TilePlacement with the position and the rotation of the tile to be placed
      player - The player who wants to place the tile

    • focus

      public void focus(doerfer.preset.TilePlacement tP)
      Sets the viewpoint of the mainLayer to the position of the given tilePlacement
      Specified by:
      focus in interface doerfer.preset.GameView
      Parameters:
      tP - the tilePlacement with the position, which tile should be in focus

    • setUncoveredTiles

      public void setUncoveredTiles(List<doerfer.preset.Tile> list)
      Sets the uncovered tiles. Not used.
      Specified by:
      setUncoveredTiles in interface doerfer.preset.GameView
      Parameters:
      list - The list of the uncovered tiles

    • setTilesLeft

      public void setTilesLeft(int i)
      Sets how many tiles are left. Not used, as the GameView asks the observer.
      Specified by:
      setTilesLeft in interface doerfer.preset.GameView
      Parameters:
      i - number of tiles left

    • setGameOver

      public void setGameOver(boolean b)
      Is called to tell the GameView, that the game is over or not. If so, the EndScreen is shown.
      Specified by:
      setGameOver in interface doerfer.preset.GameView
      Parameters:
      b - true if the game is over, false else

    • displayError

      public void displayError(Exception e)
      Displays, that an Error occurred and show the specific message
      Specified by:
      displayError in interface doerfer.preset.GameView
      Parameters:
      e - Exception from which the message is shown

    • setValidTilePlacements

      public void setValidTilePlacements(Set<doerfer.preset.TilePlacement> set)
      Sets and shows the tile placements, which are valid. Not used, as the board has dummy tiles, which indicates, where a tile could be placed.
      Specified by:
      setValidTilePlacements in interface doerfer.preset.GameView
      Parameters:
      set - The set of the valid tilePlacements

    • showInvalidMove

      public void showInvalidMove()
      If the player tries to place a tile with an incorrect rotation, the background is turning red for about half a second. Then it returns to the standard background color

    • requestTilePlacement

      public doerfer.preset.TilePlacement requestTilePlacement()
      Returns the tilePlacement, where a human player want's to place the tile (after he clicked on a tile). Not used.
      Specified by:
      requestTilePlacement in interface doerfer.preset.GameView
      Returns:
      null

    • showHUDLayer

      public void showHUDLayer() throws IOException
      Used to update the elements on the HUDLayer
      Throws:
      IOException - Exception

    • setPoints

      public void setPoints(HashMap<Integer,Integer> pointMap)
      Updates the points of the players and shows them
      Parameters:
      pointMap - HashMap of the playerID and the points

    • showDummysOnStack

      public void showDummysOnStack() throws IOException
      Shows the (up to three) Dummys on the stack and shows, if there are more dummys than shown
      Throws:
      IOException - from getVisualTile

    • showSkipped

      private void showSkipped() throws IOException
      Shows the "Skipped" Label on the screen, if a player is skipped.
      Throws:
      IOException - from GElement

    • showBoard

      public void showBoard() throws IOException
      Updates the mainLayer with tiles of the board. Also adds overlays to the tiles if 3D-mode is enabled
      Throws:
      IOException - Exception
